messages.subject: Re: Bonsai was: The Human Spirit....
messages.msgSnippet: ... I don t know what it is but I m feeling a bit better today.  Still have a achy bod and feeling a tad congested but do not have a cough or sore throat that
messages.messageBody:
> I hope it isn't the flu either as I am just getting over that! No fun!

I don't know what it is but I'm feeling a bit better today. Still
have a achy bod and feeling a tad congested but do not have a cough or
sore throat that usually accompanies the flu...maybe the elderberry
and rest worked?

> At my bookstore (Books-a-Million) we have this little kiosk of "itty
> bitty books" and "itty bitty kits" like a mini zen garden kit and mini
> hot stone therapy kit. One of the kits is a "potato bonsai tree kit"
> It's fairly fast growing and has instructions in it - everything
> except the potato. :) I'm sure that Barnes and Noble has the same
> sort of little kits. Ours is located in our cafe and the ones at B&N
> are up near the registers. Maybe something for your son to do to get
> started.


Thank you Michelle! :-)

messages.subject: Bonsai was: The Human Spirit....
messages.msgSnippet: ... I hope it isn t the flu either as I am just getting over that!  No fun! When I offered a monthly monetary fee he turned me down ... At my bookstore
messages.messageBody:
On 11/7/06, Sandy <sereneaspirations@...> wrote:
> I'm feeling very sick right now like I got hit with a truck and I'm
> hoping it isn't the flu, Elderberry here I come!

I hope it isn't the flu either as I am just getting over that! No fun!


When I offered a monthly monetary fee he turned me down
> and said,"I never charge people to share my knowledge of something
> that I love to do."

At my bookstore (Books-a-Million) we have this little kiosk of "itty
bitty books" and "itty bitty kits" like a mini zen garden kit and mini
hot stone therapy kit. One of the kits is a "potato bonsai tree kit"
It's fairly fast growing and has instructions in it - everything
except the potato. :) I'm sure that Barnes and Noble has the same
sort of little kits. Ours is located in our cafe and the ones at B&N
are up near the registers. Maybe something for your son to do to get
started.

Michelle
